header.title: Child Host Beheer
header.subtitle: Uitgebreide gids voor het cre√´ren, beheren en monitoren van child hosts inclusief WSL-instanties, containers en virtuele machines binnen uw SysManage-infrastructuur.

overview.title: Overzicht
overview.description: Child host beheer in SysManage stelt u in staat om gevirtualiseerde omgevingen direct vanuit de webinterface te cre√´ren en te beheren. Dit omvat Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) instanties, LXD/LXC containers en verschillende virtuele machine-technologie√´n. Child hosts worden automatisch geregistreerd als beheerde hosts met de sysmanage-agent vooraf ge√Ønstalleerd.
overview.concept_parent: Parent Host: De fysieke of virtuele machine die child-omgevingen host
overview.concept_child: Child Host: Een gevirtualiseerde omgeving (WSL, container of VM) die draait op een parent host
overview.concept_distribution: Distributie: De besturingssysteemimage die wordt gebruikt om child hosts te cre√´ren (bijv. Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora)
overview.concept_virtualization: Virtualisatietype: De gebruikte technologie (WSL, LXD, VirtualBox, Hyper-V, KVM, enz.)
overview.concept_agent: Automatische Agent-Installatie: Child hosts ontvangen automatisch de sysmanage-agent tijdens het aanmaken
overview.type_wsl: WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux): Voer Linux-distributies uit op Windows-hosts

detection.title: Virtualisatiedetectie
detection.process_desc: SysManage detecteert automatisch virtualisatiemogelijkheden op elke beheerde host. De agent vraagt het systeem af om te bepalen welke virtualisatietechnologie√´n beschikbaar zijn en rapporteert deze informatie aan de server.

detection.cap_reboot: In afwachting van Configuratie: Functies die een herstart vereisen om in te schakelen
detection.wsl_desc: Op Windows-hosts detecteert SysManage de WSL-status en kan WSL automatisch inschakelen als het nog niet is geconfigureerd:
detection.wsl_not_installed: Niet Ge√Ønstalleerd: WSL-functie is niet ingeschakeld - kan worden ingeschakeld via SysManage
detection.wsl_needs_reboot: Herstart Vereist: WSL is ingeschakeld maar vereist een systeemherstart
detection.wsl_ready: Gereed: WSL is ingeschakeld en klaar om child hosts te cre√´ren

create.step1: Klik op de "Create Child Host" knop op het Child Hosts tabblad

create.step3: Kies een distributie uit de dropdown-lijst

create.field_type: Virtualisatietype: WSL, LXD, VirtualBox, enz. (gebaseerd op host-mogelijkheden)
create.field_distribution: Distributie: Het besturingssysteem om te installeren (bijv. Ubuntu 24.04 LTS)
create.field_hostname: Hostnaam: Unieke identifier voor de child host (aanbevolen formaat: parent-wsl-distro)
create.field_username: Gebruikersnaam: Het niet-root gebruikersaccount om aan te maken
create.field_password: Wachtwoord: Wachtwoord voor het nieuwe gebruikersaccount (niet opgeslagen door SysManage)
create.progress_desc: Tijdens het aanmaken toont SysManage realtime voortgang inclusief:
create.approval_desc: Nadat het aanmaken is voltooid, zal de agent van de nieuwe child host verbinding maken met de server. Een beheerder moet de nieuwe host goedkeuren in de Hosts-lijst, net als elke andere nieuwe agentregistratie. Zodra goedgekeurd, wordt de child host volledig beheerd.

manage.title: Child Hosts Beheren
manage.start_desc: Start een gestopte child host. De child zal opstarten en beginnen met rapporteren aan SysManage.
manage.stop_desc: Sluit een actieve child host netjes af. Alle processen binnen de child worden be√´indigd.
manage.restart_desc: Stopt en start vervolgens de child host. Nuttig voor het toepassen van configuratiewijzigingen.
manage.delete_desc: Verwijdert de child host en alle gegevens permanent. Deze actie kan niet ongedaan worden gemaakt.
manage.delete_warning_desc: Het verwijderen van een child host verwijdert permanent alle opgeslagen gegevens. Voor WSL voert dit 'wsl --unregister' uit, wat de distributie volledig verwijdert. Zorg ervoor dat u back-ups heeft van belangrijke gegevens voordat u verwijdert.
manage.status_running: Actief: Child host is actief en responsief
manage.status_pending: In afwachting van Goedkeuring: Agent wacht op goedkeuring van beheerder
manage.status_error: Fout: Er is een fout opgetreden - controleer details voor meer informatie

lxd.title: LXD Container Beheer
lxd.overview_desc: LXD is een moderne container- en virtuele-machine manager voor Linux. Het biedt een uniforme ervaring voor het draaien van systeemcontainers en virtuele machines, waardoor het ideaal is voor het beheren van meerdere ge√Øsoleerde Linux-omgevingen op een enkele host.
lxd.req_installed: LXD moet ge√Ønstalleerd zijn op de host (snap of native pakket)
lxd.req_initialized: LXD moet ge√Ønitialiseerd zijn (lxd init voltooid)
lxd.req_user: De sysmanage-agent gebruiker moet in de lxd groep zitten
lxd.detection_desc: SysManage detecteert automatisch wanneer een host LXD-mogelijkheden heeft:
lxd.detect_2: Verifieert dat LXD ge√Ønitialiseerd is en draait
lxd.detection_role: Hosts met LXD-mogelijkheid tonen de rol LXD Host in hun hostdetails.
lxd.setup_desc: Om LXD child host beheer in te schakelen:
lxd.setup_step1: Installeer LXD: sudo snap install lxd of sudo apt install lxd
lxd.setup_step2: Initialiseer LXD: sudo lxd init (accepteer standaardwaarden of configureer naar behoefte)
lxd.setup_step3: Voeg de sysmanage-agent gebruiker toe aan de lxd groep: sudo usermod -aG lxd sysmanage-agent
lxd.creation_desc: Volg het standaard child host aanmaakproces om een nieuwe LXD container aan te maken:
lxd.creation_step1: Navigeer naar de parent host in de SysManage interface
lxd.creation_step4: Kies een distributie uit de beschikbare opties
lxd.creation_step6: Klik op "Aanmaken" om het aanmaakproces te starten
lxd.creation_step7: Wacht tot de container is aangemaakt en de agent is ge√Ønstalleerd
lxd.creation_step8: Keur de nieuwe child host goed wanneer deze verschijnt in In Afwachting Zijnde Hosts
lxd.networking_desc: LXD containers gebruiken standaard de lxdbr0 brug voor netwerken. Dit biedt:
lxd.net_nat: NAT: Containers kunnen externe netwerken bereiken via de host
lxd.networking_note: Containers kunnen communiceren met de SysManage-server via het netwerk van de host, waardoor de agent kan verbinden en rapporteren.
lxd.distributions_desc: SysManage wordt geleverd met vooraf geconfigureerde ondersteuning voor LXD-distributies waar sysmanage-agent pakketten beschikbaar zijn:
lxd.comparison_desc: LXD en WSL dienen verschillende gebruikssituaties:
lxd.comparison_platform: Platform: LXD draait op Linux, WSL draait op Windows
lxd.comparison_tech: Technologie: LXD gebruikt native Linux containers, WSL gebruikt een compatibiliteitslaag
lxd.comparison_networking: Netwerken: LXD heeft volledig brugnetwerken, WSL heeft NAT-netwerken
lxd.comparison_images: Images: LXD gebruikt standaard Linux container images, WSL gebruikt Microsoft Store distributies
lxd.comparison_features: Functies: LXD ondersteunt snapshots, migratie en geavanceerde opslag; WSL focust op ontwikkelaars workflows

troubleshooting.title: Probleemoplossing
troubleshooting.issue1_sol1: Verifieer dat de parent host netwerkverbinding heeft
troubleshooting.issue1_sol2: Controleer of de distributie is ingeschakeld in Instellingen
troubleshooting.issue1_sol3: Zorg voor voldoende schijfruimte op de parent host
troubleshooting.issue1_sol4: Bekijk het foutbericht in de child host status
troubleshooting.issue2_desc: Dit is normaal gedrag. Gebruik de herstartfunctie van SysManage om de Windows-host opnieuw te starten en probeer daarna opnieuw child hosts aan te maken.
troubleshooting.issue3_title: Agent Maakt Geen Verbinding Na Aanmaak

troubleshooting.issue3_sol3: Verifieer netwerkverbinding van de child naar de SysManage-server
troubleshooting.issue3_sol4: Bekijk de agent logs voor verbindingsfouten
troubleshooting.issue4_desc: Klik op de child host om de foutdetails te bekijken. Veelvoorkomende oorzaken zijn:
troubleshooting.issue4_sol3: Aanmaken van gebruiker heeft een fout opgeleverd
troubleshooting.issue5_desc: Als LXD container aanmaak mislukt, controleer het volgende:

troubleshooting.issue6_sol3: Zorg dat IP forwarding is ingeschakeld: sysctl net.ipv4.ip_forward
troubleshooting.issue7_desc: Als de LXD host rol niet wordt gedetecteerd:

troubleshooting.issue7_sol2: Verifieer dat LXD draait: systemctl status snap.lxd.daemon
troubleshooting.issue7_sol3: Herstart sysmanage-agent voor herbeoordeling van rollen
troubleshooting.issue8_desc: Als sysmanage-agent geen LXD containers kan beheren:

troubleshooting.issue9_sol3: Stellen Sie sicher, dass der sysmanage-agent-Benutzer in der libvirt-Gruppe ist: groups sysmanage-agent
troubleshooting.issue9_sol5: Pr√ºfen Sie, ob die Cloud-Image-URL vom Host aus erreichbar ist
troubleshooting.issue10_sol1: √úberpr√ºfen Sie, ob das Standardnetzwerk aktiv ist: virsh net-list

troubleshooting.issue10_sol4: √úberpr√ºfen Sie, ob die virbr0-Br√ºcke existiert: ip addr show virbr0
troubleshooting.issue11_sol1: √úberpr√ºfen Sie, ob /dev/kvm existiert und zug√§nglich ist
troubleshooting.issue11_sol2: Pr√ºfen Sie, ob libvirtd l√§uft und der virsh-Befehl funktioniert
troubleshooting.issue11_sol3: Stellen Sie sicher, dass der sysmanage-agent-Benutzer libvirt-Gruppenmitglied ist
troubleshooting.issue11_sol4: Starten Sie sysmanage-agent nach dem Hinzuf√ºgen zur libvirt-Gruppe neu
troubleshooting.issue12_sol3: √úberpr√ºfen Sie, ob die DNS-Aufl√∂sung in der VM funktioniert

kvm.title: KVM/QEMU Virtual Machine Management
kvm.overview_desc: KVM (Kernel-basierte Virtuelle Maschine) ist eine Virtualisierungstechnologie, die in den Linux-Kernel integriert ist. In Kombination mit QEMU f√ºr Hardware-Emulation und libvirt f√ºr die Verwaltung bietet sie unternehmenstaugliche Funktionen f√ºr virtuelle Maschinen. SysManage integriert sich mit KVM/libvirt, um eine nahtlose VM-Erstellung und Lebenszyklusverwaltung √ºber die Weboberfl√§che zu erm√∂glichen.
kvm.req_cpu: CPU mit Hardware-Virtualisierungsunterst√ºtzung (Intel VT-x oder AMD-V)
kvm.req_user: Der sysmanage-agent-Benutzer muss in der libvirt-Gruppe sein
kvm.detection_desc: SysManage erkennt automatisch die KVM-F√§higkeit durch √úberpr√ºfung von:
kvm.detection_role: Bei Erkennung wird dem Host die Rolle KVM Host zugewiesen und KVM erscheint als verf√ºgbarer Virtualisierungstyp.
kvm.setup_desc: Um einen Host f√ºr die KVM-Virtual-Machine-Verwaltung vorzubereiten:
kvm.setup_step2: KVM-Pakete installieren: sudo apt install qemu-kvm libvirt-daemon-system (Debian/Ubuntu) oder sudo dnf install qemu-kvm libvirt (Fedora/RHEL)
kvm.setup_step3: libvirtd aktivieren und starten: sudo systemctl enable --now libvirtd
kvm.setup_step4: Agent-Benutzer zur libvirt-Gruppe hinzuf√ºgen: sudo usermod -aG libvirt sysmanage-agent
kvm.setup_step5: Standardnetzwerk konfigurieren: sudo virsh net-autostart default && sudo virsh net-start default
kvm.setup_step6: sysmanage-agent-Dienst neu starten, um Gruppenmitgliedschaft zu √ºbernehmen
kvm.setup_auto: Alternativ klicken Sie auf "KVM aktivieren" in der SysManage-Weboberfl√§che, um diese Einrichtungsschritte zu automatisieren.
kvm.creation_desc: Bei der Erstellung einer KVM-Virtual-Machine √ºber SysManage:
kvm.creation_step1: SysManage l√§dt das Cloud-Image von der offiziellen Quelle der Distribution herunter
kvm.creation_step2: Ein neues Disk-Image wird erstellt und das Cloud-Image als Backing Store angewendet
kvm.creation_step3: Cloud-init-Konfiguration wird mit Hostname, Benutzerkonto und Agent-Einstellungen generiert
kvm.creation_step4: Die VM wird in libvirt mit den angegebenen Ressourcen (CPU, Speicher, Disk) definiert
kvm.creation_step5: VM startet und cloud-init konfiguriert das System, erstellt den Benutzer und installiert den Agent
kvm.creation_step6: Der sysmanage-agent-Dienst startet und verbindet sich mit Ihrem SysManage-Server
kvm.creation_step7: Die VM erscheint in der Host-Liste zur Genehmigung (oder automatisch genehmigt, falls ausgew√§hlt)
kvm.form_desc: Bei der Erstellung von KVM-VMs sind zus√§tzliche Konfigurationsoptionen verf√ºgbar:
kvm.field_vm_name: VM-Name: Der libvirt-Domainname (muss auf dem Host eindeutig sein)
kvm.field_cpus: vCPUs: Anzahl der virtuellen CPUs - Standard ist 2
kvm.networking_desc: KVM-VMs verbinden sich mit dem libvirt-Standardnetzwerk, das bietet:
kvm.net_dhcp: DHCP: VMs erhalten automatisch IP-Adressen von der virbr0-Br√ºcke (typischerweise 192.168.122.x)
kvm.net_nat: NAT: Ausgehende Konnektivit√§t wird √ºber NAT durch den Host bereitgestellt
kvm.net_dns: DNS: VMs verwenden die DNS-Server des Hosts f√ºr die Namensaufl√∂sung
kvm.networking_bridged: F√ºr fortgeschrittenes Netzwerk unterst√ºtzt SysManage auch den Bridged-Modus, bei dem VMs IP-Adressen direkt vom DHCP-Server Ihres Netzwerks erhalten.
kvm.lifecycle_desc: Nach der Erstellung unterst√ºtzen KVM-VMs den vollen Umfang von Lebenszyklusoperationen:
kvm.lifecycle_stop: Stopp: Die VM mit virsh shutdown sauber herunterfahren
kvm.lifecycle_restart: Neustart: Die VM mit virsh reboot neu starten
kvm.lifecycle_delete: L√∂schen: Die VM und ihren Speicher mit virsh undefine --remove-all-storage entfernen

firewall.title: Firewallbeheer - SysManage Administratie
firewall.meta_description: Volledige gids voor het implementeren, beheren en monitoren van firewallsoftware in uw infrastructuur met SysManage.

header.title: Firewallbeheer
header.subtitle: Uitgebreide gids voor het implementeren, configureren en beheren van firewallsoftware in uw infrastructuur met realtime monitoring en controle.

overview.title: Overzicht
overview.description: SysManage biedt gecentraliseerd beheer van firewallsoftware op alle ondersteunde platforms. Het platform automatiseert de implementatie, maakt realtime monitoring van de firewallstatus mogelijk en biedt tools om firewallsoftware op afstand in te schakelen, uit te schakelen, opnieuw te starten of te implementeren.

features.cross_platform: Cross-platform Ondersteuning: Beheer firewalls op Linux-, BSD-, macOS- en Windows-systemen
features.auto_detection: Automatische Detectie: Agents detecteren en rapporteren automatisch de status van firewallsoftware
features.remote_deployment: Externe Implementatie: Implementeer firewallsoftware vanaf de webinterface met √©√©n klik
features.service_control: Servicebeheer: Schakel firewallservices op afstand in, uit of start ze opnieuw
features.port_monitoring: Poortmonitoring: Realtime monitoring van open poorten en firewallregels
features.realtime_status: Realtime Status: Monitor firewallstatus, ingeschakelde/uitgeschakelde status en poortconfiguratie
features.agent_protection: Agentbescherming: Opent automatisch de vereiste poorten voor agentcommunicatie bij het inschakelen van de firewall

roles.title: Firewall Rollen
roles.description: Firewall Rollen bieden gecentraliseerde, herbruikbare firewall-configuraties die kunnen worden toegewezen aan meerdere hosts. In plaats van firewallregels individueel op elke host te configureren, definieert u rollen die specificeren welke poorten open moeten zijn, en wijst u die rollen vervolgens toe aan hosts waar nodig.
roles.benefit_consistency: Consistentie: Zorg ervoor dat alle hosts met dezelfde rol identieke firewall-configuraties hebben
roles.benefit_efficiency: Efficientie: Definieer eenmaal, pas toe op veel hosts
roles.benefit_flexibility: Flexibiliteit: Voeg eenvoudig rollen toe aan of verwijder ze van hosts wanneer vereisten veranderen
roles.benefit_auditing: Auditing: Duidelijk inzicht in welke poorten open zijn op welke hosts en waarom
roles.creating_role_steps_title: Stappen om een Rol aan te Maken
roles.creating_role_step2: Klik op Firewall Rollen in het submenu
roles.creating_role_step3: Klik op de knop Nieuwe Rol Toevoegen
roles.creating_role_step4: Voer een beschrijvende naam in voor de rol (bijv. "Webserver", "Databaseserver")
roles.creating_role_step5: Voeg poorten toe aan de rol door het poortnummer en protocol (TCP/UDP) op te geven
roles.creating_role_step6: Selecteer of de poort open moet zijn voor IPv4, IPv6 of beide
roles.creating_role_step7: Klik op Opslaan om de rol aan te maken
roles.port_config_number: Poortnummer: De te openen poort (1-65535, of 0 voor elke poort)
roles.port_config_tcp: TCP: Activeer om TCP-verkeer op deze poort toe te staan
roles.port_config_udp: UDP: Activeer om UDP-verkeer op deze poort toe te staan
roles.common_ports_description: Bij het toevoegen van poorten kunt u kiezen uit een dropdown van veelvoorkomende poorten voor snelle configuratie:
roles.assigning_roles_description: Nadat u firewall-rollen hebt aangemaakt, kunt u deze toewijzen aan hosts vanaf de hostdetailpagina:
roles.assigning_step1: Navigeer naar de hostdetailpagina voor de doelhost
roles.assigning_step4: Selecteer een of meer rollen om toe te wijzen uit de dropdown
roles.assigning_step5: Klik op Opslaan om de rollen toe te passen
roles.assigning_note: Opmerking: Wanneer rollen worden toegewezen, stuurt SysManage automatisch de nieuwe firewall-configuratie naar de agent, die de firewallregels van de host in realtime bijwerkt.
roles.removing_roles_description: Om een firewall-rol te verwijderen van een host:
roles.removing_step2: Zoek de rol die u wilt verwijderen in de sectie Firewall Rollen
roles.removing_step3: Klik op de knop Verwijderen naast de rol
roles.removing_step4: Bevestig de verwijdering wanneer daarom wordt gevraagd
roles.removing_note: Opmerking: Wanneer een rol wordt verwijderd, worden de poorten die door die rol werden geopend automatisch gesloten, tenzij een andere toegewezen rol die poorten ook vereist.
roles.example_description: Hier is een voorbeeld van het aanmaken van een typische webserver firewall-rol:
roles.example_assign: Deze rol kan vervolgens worden toegewezen aan al uw webservers, waardoor een consistente firewall-configuratie in uw webinfrastructuur wordt gewaarborgd.
roles.platform_support_description: Firewall Rollen werken op alle platforms die door SysManage worden ondersteund:

architecture.agent_collector: Firewall Collector (src/sysmanage_agent/operations/firewall_collector.py): Detects and parses firewall status
architecture.flow_step1: User clicks firewall button in web interface
architecture.flow_step10: Frontend receives real-time update via WebSocket
architecture.flow_step2: Frontend sends REST API request to server
architecture.flow_step4: Server enqueues firewall command message for agent
architecture.flow_step5: Agent retrieves command from outbound message queue
architecture.flow_step8: Agent sends status update to server via inbound queue
architecture.server_api: Firewall Status API (backend/api/firewall_status.py): REST endpoints for firewall operations
architecture.server_models: Database Models (backend/persistence/models/core.py): FirewallStatus table for storing firewall state
architecture.server_queue: Message Queue: Queues firewall commands for delivery to agents
architecture.title: Technical Architecture

best_practices.configuration_practice1: Regularly review and audit firewall rules
best_practices.configuration_practice2: Use restart operation after manual configuration changes
best_practices.configuration_practice3: Document all manual firewall rule modifications
best_practices.configuration_practice4: Implement firewall configuration as code where possible
best_practices.deployment_practice1: Test firewall deployment on non-production hosts first
best_practices.deployment_practice2: Ensure you have alternate access (console, IPMI) before enabling firewalls on remote hosts
best_practices.deployment_practice3: Document custom port requirements before deployment
best_practices.deployment_practice4: Use gradual rollout for firewall deployment across large infrastructures
best_practices.monitoring_practice1: Set up alerts for hosts with disabled firewalls
best_practices.monitoring_practice2: Regularly review open ports across your infrastructure
best_practices.monitoring_practice3: Verify firewall status as part of security audits
best_practices.monitoring_practice4: Monitor for unexpected firewall status changes
best_practices.security_practice1: Grant firewall management roles only to trusted administrators
best_practices.security_practice2: Monitor firewall disable operations in security logs
best_practices.security_practice3: Implement alerts for firewall status changes
best_practices.security_practice4: Regularly verify firewall status matches security policy
best_practices.security_practice5: Use principle of least privilege when opening ports
best_practices.title: Best Practices

monitoring.automatic_updates_description: The agent automatically collects firewall status and sends updates to the server:
monitoring.description: The Firewall Status card on each host detail page provides real-time information about the firewall configuration.

info.firewall_name: Firewall Name: The detected firewall software (e.g., ufw, firewalld, IPFW, PF, NPF, Windows Defender Firewall)
info.ipv4_ports: IPv4 Ports: Ports configured for IPv4 traffic
info.ipv6_ports: IPv6 Ports: Ports configured for IPv6 traffic
info.last_updated: Last Updated: Timestamp of the last status update from the agent
info.tcp_ports: TCP Open Ports: List of TCP ports with active allow rules
info.udp_ports: UDP Open Ports: List of UDP ports with active allow rules

monitoring.title: Firewall Status Monitoring

updates.after_operations: Immediate update after deploy, enable, disable, or restart operations
updates.periodic: Periodic collection as part of regular system metrics gathering
updates.realtime_display: Real-time display updates via WebSocket communication

deploy.automatic_ports_description: When deploying or enabling a firewall, SysManage automatically opens the following ports:
deploy.description: The Deploy Firewall operation installs and configures firewall software on hosts that don't have it installed or enabled.
deploy.port_agent: Agent Communication Port: Dynamically determined from agent configuration
deploy.port_server: Server Ports (if applicable): Opened if SysManage server is detected on the host
deploy.step1: Navigate to the host detail page for the target system
deploy.step4: SysManage will automatically detect the appropriate firewall for the OS
deploy.step5: The agent installs the firewall package and configures initial rules
deploy.step6: Agent communication ports are automatically opened to prevent lockout
deploy.title: Deploy Firewall

disable.description: The Disable Firewall operation stops the firewall service, allowing all traffic through the host.
disable.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
disable.step2: Click the Disable Firewall button in the Firewall Status card
disable.step4: Firewall status will update to "Disabled" in real-time
disable.title: Disable Firewall
disable.warning_description: Disabling the firewall removes network protection and exposes all services to the network. Only disable firewalls in controlled environments or when troubleshooting network connectivity issues.

enable.description: The Enable Firewall operation starts the firewall service on a host where firewall software is installed but disabled.
enable.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
enable.step2: Click the Enable Firewall button in the Firewall Status card
enable.step3: The firewall service will start and required ports will be opened
enable.step4: Firewall status will update to "Enabled" in real-time
enable.title: Enable Firewall

restart.description: The Restart Firewall operation stops and starts the firewall service, reloading configuration and rules.
restart.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
restart.step2: Click the Restart Firewall button in the Firewall Status card
restart.step3: The firewall service will restart and reload all rules
restart.step4: Use this after manually modifying firewall configuration files
restart.title: Restart Firewall

security.assignment_step4: Select the appropriate firewall management roles
security.description: Firewall management operations are protected by role-based access control (RBAC). Users must have specific security roles to perform firewall operations.
security.role_assignment_description: Administrators can assign firewall roles to users through the user management interface:
security.role_deploy: DEPLOY_FIREWALL: Required to deploy firewall software to hosts
security.role_view: VIEW_FIREWALL_STATUS: Required to view firewall status (automatically granted with any firewall role)
security.title: Security and Access Control

bsd.description: BSD platforms support multiple firewall frameworks:
bsd.ipfw: IPFW: FreeBSD's stateful firewall with flexible rule syntax
bsd.npf: NPF: NetBSD's modern, efficient packet filter designed for scalability
bsd.pf: PF: OpenBSD's sophisticated packet filter available on all BSD variants
bsd.title: BSD Systems

linux.description: SysManage supports the following firewall solutions on Linux:
linux.firewalld: firewalld - Dynamic firewall management tool for RHEL, CentOS, Fedora, and openSUSE
linux.iptables: iptables - Legacy netfilter firewall for Linux systems
linux.nftables: nftables - Modern packet filtering framework replacing iptables
linux.title: Linux Systems
linux.ufw: UFW (Uncomplicated Firewall) - User-friendly firewall frontend for iptables on Ubuntu/Debian systems

macos.pf: PF (Packet Filter): OpenBSD's packet filter ported to macOS
macos.title: macOS

windows.defender: Windows Defender Firewall: Integrated host-based firewall with advanced security features
windows.profiles: Support for Domain, Private, and Public network profiles
windows.rules: Inbound and outbound rule management via PowerShell and netsh
windows.title: Windows

troubleshooting.deploy_fails_solution1: Verify the agent is running with elevated privileges (root/Administrator)
troubleshooting.deploy_fails_solution2: Check network connectivity to package repositories
troubleshooting.deploy_fails_solution3: Review agent logs for detailed error messages
troubleshooting.deploy_fails_solution4: Ensure package manager is functioning (apt, yum, dnf, pkg, etc.)
troubleshooting.deploy_fails_symptoms: Symptoms: Deploy operation returns error or times out
troubleshooting.locked_out_solution1: This should not happen - agent automatically opens required ports
troubleshooting.locked_out_solution2: Access host via console or out-of-band management
troubleshooting.locked_out_solution3: Manually disable firewall and check agent configuration
troubleshooting.locked_out_solution4: Verify agent port configuration matches firewall rules
troubleshooting.locked_out_symptoms: Symptoms: Cannot connect to agent after enabling firewall
troubleshooting.no_firewall_detected_solution1: Click "Deploy Firewall" to install firewall software automatically
troubleshooting.no_firewall_detected_solution2: Verify the agent has privileges to detect firewall status
troubleshooting.no_firewall_detected_solution3: Check agent logs for firewall detection errors
troubleshooting.no_firewall_detected_symptoms: Symptoms: Firewall Status card shows "No firewall detected"
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution1: Verify your user account has the required firewall security role
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution2: Contact administrator to request firewall management permissions
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution3: Check that role assignments have been saved and user session refreshed
troubleshooting.permission_denied_symptoms: Symptoms: Button is disabled or operation returns "Permission denied"
troubleshooting.status_not_updating_solution1: Click "Request Host Data" to force immediate status collection
troubleshooting.status_not_updating_solution3: Review agent logs for errors during status collection
troubleshooting.status_not_updating_solution4: Verify WebSocket connection is active (check browser console)
troubleshooting.status_not_updating_symptoms: Symptoms: Firewall Status card shows stale or incorrect information
troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting

host_accounts.title: Hostaccountbeheer - SysManage Administratie
host_accounts.meta_description: Volledige handleiding voor het maken en beheren van gebruikersaccounts en groepen op externe hosts met SysManage.

header.title: Hostaccountbeheer
header.subtitle: Maak en beheer gebruikersaccounts en groepen op externe hosts op alle ondersteunde platforms.

overview.title: Overzicht
overview.description: SysManage provides centralized management of user accounts and groups on remote hosts. Create users and groups from the web interface without needing direct SSH access, with full support for platform-specific options across Linux, BSD, macOS, and Windows systems.

features.cross_platform: Cross-Platform Support: Create users and groups on Linux, BSD, macOS, and Windows
features.platform_specific: Platform-Specific Options: Configure shell, home directory, UID/GID, and Windows-specific settings
features.web_interface: Web Interface: Create accounts directly from the host detail page
features.rbac: Role-Based Access: Granular permissions for account and group management
features.audit_logging: Audit Logging: All account operations are logged for compliance
features.privileged_mode: Privileged Mode Required: Agent must run with elevated privileges for account management

linux.title: Linux-systemen
linux.description: User and group creation uses standard useradd and groupadd commands:

bsd.title: BSD-systemen
bsd.description: BSD platforms use their native account management tools:

macos.title: macOS
macos.description: macOS uses Directory Services for account management:

windows.title: Windows
windows.description: Windows uses native account management commands:
windows.net_user: net user: Create and manage local user accounts
windows.net_localgroup: net localgroup: Create and manage local groups

create.title: Een Gebruikersaccount Maken
create.description: Create new user accounts on remote hosts through the web interface or API.
create.step1: Navigate to the host detail page for the target system
create.step2: Locate the Users card in the host details
create.step4: Fill in the required username and optional fields
create.step6: The user list will update automatically after creation
create.opt_fullname: Full name or comment for the user
create.opt_createhome: Create home directory if it doesn't exist
create.opt_primarygroup: Primary group name for the user
create.opt_mustchange: Require password change on first login

create.title: Een Groep Maken
create.description: Create new groups on remote hosts through the web interface or API.
create.step1: Navigate to the host detail page for the target system
create.step2: Locate the Groups card in the host details
create.step4: Fill in the required group name and optional fields
create.step6: The group list will update automatically after creation
create.opt_description: Description or comment for the group

privileged_mode.title: Bevoorrechte Modus Vereist
privileged_mode.description: The SysManage agent must be running in privileged mode (as root or Administrator) to create user accounts and groups. If the agent is not running in privileged mode, the Add User and Add Group buttons will be disabled.
privileged_mode.check_description: The host detail page shows whether the agent is running in privileged mode. Look for the "Agent Privileged" indicator in the host information section.
privileged_mode.warning_description: Running the agent in privileged mode grants it elevated system access. Only enable privileged mode on hosts where you need account management or other privileged operations.

active_host.title: Actieve Hostverbinding
active_host.description: The target host must be active and connected to the SysManage server. Account creation requests are queued and delivered to the agent when it's online.

security.title: Beveiliging en Toegangsbeheer
security.description: Host account management operations are protected by role-based access control (RBAC). Users must have specific security roles to create accounts and groups.
security.role_add_account: ADD_HOST_ACCOUNT: Required to create user accounts on hosts
security.role_add_group: ADD_HOST_GROUP: Required to create groups on hosts
security.role_edit_account: EDIT_HOST_ACCOUNT: Required to modify existing user accounts
security.role_assignment_description: Administrators can assign host account management roles to users through the user management interface:
security.assignment_step4: Select the appropriate host account management roles

troubleshooting.title: Probleemoplossing
troubleshooting.button_disabled_symptoms: Symptoms: The Add User or Add Group button is grayed out
troubleshooting.button_disabled_solution1: Verify the agent is running in privileged mode
troubleshooting.button_disabled_solution2: Check that you have the required ADD_HOST_ACCOUNT or ADD_HOST_GROUP role
troubleshooting.button_disabled_solution3: Ensure the host is active and connected
troubleshooting.creation_fails_solution1: Check that the username/group name doesn't already exist
troubleshooting.creation_fails_solution2: Verify the UID/GID isn't already in use
troubleshooting.creation_fails_solution3: Review agent logs for detailed error messages
troubleshooting.creation_fails_solution4: Ensure the specified shell exists on the target system
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution1: Verify your user account has the required role (ADD_HOST_ACCOUNT or ADD_HOST_GROUP)
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution2: Contact administrator to request host account management permissions
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution3: Refresh your session after role changes
troubleshooting.list_not_updating_symptoms: Symptoms: Created user/group doesn't appear in the list
troubleshooting.list_not_updating_solution1: Wait a few moments for the agent to report updated data
troubleshooting.list_not_updating_solution2: Click "Request Host Data" to force an immediate update
troubleshooting.list_not_updating_solution3: Check WebSocket connection status in browser console

best_practices.title: Best Practices
best_practices.naming_practice1: Use consistent username formats across your infrastructure
best_practices.naming_practice2: Follow your organization's naming standards for service accounts
best_practices.naming_practice3: Use descriptive group names that indicate purpose
best_practices.security_practice1: Grant host account management roles only to trusted administrators
best_practices.security_practice2: Review audit logs for account creation activities
best_practices.security_practice3: Use separate service accounts for applications rather than shared accounts
best_practices.security_practice4: Implement password policies for Windows accounts
best_practices.operational_practice1: Create groups before creating users that need to belong to them
best_practices.operational_practice2: Document custom UID/GID assignments to avoid conflicts
best_practices.operational_practice3: Test account creation on non-production hosts first

deploy_early.description: Deploy antivirus software immediately after host approval for maximum protection.
deploy_early.title: Deploy Early

monitor_regularly.description: Regularly review antivirus status across your infrastructure to ensure all systems are protected.
monitor_regularly.title: Monitor Regularly

privileged_agents.description: Ensure agents run with elevated privileges (root/administrator) to enable full antivirus management capabilities.
privileged_agents.title: Run Agents with Privileges

role_based_access.description: Restrict antivirus management permissions to trusted administrators only, especially REMOVE_ANTIVIRUS and DISABLE_ANTIVIRUS roles.
role_based_access.title: Use Role-Based Access Control

standards.description: Use the default configuration feature to ensure consistent antivirus deployment across all hosts of the same operating system.
standards.title: Maintain Consistent Standards

test_deployments.description: Test antivirus deployment on non-production hosts before rolling out to production systems.
test_deployments.title: Test Deployments

defaults.description: SysManage allows administrators to define which antivirus software should be deployed for each operating system. These defaults are used when deploying antivirus to hosts.
defaults.permissions_description: Managing antivirus defaults requires the MANAGE_ANTIVIRUS_DEFAULTS security role. Contact your administrator if you need this permission.
defaults.step1: Navigate to Settings in the main menu
defaults.step3: For each operating system, select the desired antivirus package from the dropdown
defaults.step4: Select "None" to disable automatic antivirus deployment for that OS
defaults.title: Setting Default Antivirus Software

deployment.overview_description: Antivirus deployment in SysManage is a fully automated process that installs and configures the antivirus software appropriate for the target host's operating system.

process.description: The deployment process varies slightly by platform but generally follows these steps:

linux_bsd.step2: ClamAV and related packages are downloaded and installed
linux_bsd.step3: freshclam service is enabled and started (updates virus definitions)
linux_bsd.step4: clamd service is enabled and started (real-time scanning daemon)
linux_bsd.step5: Initial virus definition update is performed
linux_bsd.step6: Agent reports deployment status back to server

macos.step2: freshclam is configured and virus definitions are updated
macos.step3: ClamAV service is started via brew services

process.title: What Happens During Deployment

windows.step1: ClamAV for Windows installer is downloaded
windows.step3: ClamAV Windows service is configured and started

requirements.active_host: Host must be active and connected to the server
requirements.default_configured: A default antivirus package must be configured for the host's operating system
requirements.network: Host must have internet access to download antivirus packages
requirements.privileged_agent: Agent must be running with elevated privileges (root/administrator)
requirements.title: Prerequisites

steps.step1: Navigate to Hosts in the main menu
steps.step2: Click on the desired host to view its details
steps.step3: Scroll to the Antivirus card on the host detail page
steps.step4: If no antivirus is detected, you will see a "Deploy Antivirus" button
steps.step6: Confirm the deployment in the dialog that appears
steps.step7: Monitor the deployment progress - the antivirus card will update when deployment completes
steps.title: Deploying via Web Interface

deployment.title: Deploying Antivirus Software

header.subtitle: Comprehensive guide to deploying, configuring, and managing antivirus software across your infrastructure with real-time monitoring and control.
header.title: Antivirus Management

antivirus.meta_description: Complete guide to deploying, managing, and monitoring antivirus software across your infrastructure with SysManage.

indicators.disabled: Disabled (Yellow): Antivirus is installed but not running
indicators.enabled: Enabled (Green): Antivirus is installed and actively running
indicators.not_installed: Not Installed (Gray): No antivirus software detected on the host
indicators.title: Status Indicators

monitoring.overview_description: SysManage agents automatically detect installed antivirus software and report status information to the server. This information is displayed in real-time on the host detail page.

status.enabled_state: Enabled/Disabled: Whether the antivirus service is currently running
status.install_path: Installation Path: Where the antivirus software is installed
status.last_updated: Last Updated: When the status information was last refreshed
status.software_name: Software Name: The name of the detected antivirus software (e.g., "ClamAV")
status.title: Status Information Displayed
status.version: Version: The installed version of the antivirus software

monitoring.title: Monitoring Antivirus Status

viewing.step1: Navigate to Hosts in the main menu
viewing.step3: Scroll to the Antivirus section on the host detail page
viewing.step4: Status information is displayed in a card with a shield icon
viewing.title: Viewing Antivirus Status

overview.description: SysManage provides centralized management of open-source antivirus software across all supported platforms. The platform automates deployment, enables real-time monitoring of antivirus status, and provides tools to enable, disable, or remove antivirus software remotely.

features.auto_detection: Automatic Detection: Agents automatically detect and report antivirus software status
features.centralized_config: Centralized Configuration: Define default antivirus packages per operating system
features.cross_platform: Cross-Platform Support: Manage antivirus on Linux, BSD, macOS, and Windows systems
features.realtime_status: Real-time Status: Monitor antivirus status, version, and enabled/disabled state
features.remote_deployment: Remote Deployment: Deploy antivirus software from the web interface with one click
features.service_control: Service Control: Enable or disable antivirus services remotely

overview.title: Overview

security_roles.deploy: Allows user to deploy antivirus software to hosts
security_roles.disable: Allows user to disable antivirus services on hosts
security_roles.enable: Allows user to enable antivirus services on hosts
security_roles.manage_defaults: Allows user to configure default antivirus packages per operating system
security_roles.remove: Allows user to completely remove antivirus software from hosts
security_roles.title: Security Roles

disable.description: To temporarily disable antivirus without removing it:
disable.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
disable.step2: In the Antivirus card, click Disable Antivirus
disable.step3: Confirm the action in the dialog
disable.step4: The agent will stop the antivirus service
disable.title: Disabling Antivirus
disable.warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Security Warning: Disabling antivirus leaves the system vulnerable to malware. Only disable antivirus when necessary for troubleshooting.

enable.description: If antivirus is installed but disabled, you can enable it remotely:
enable.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
enable.step2: In the Antivirus card, click Enable Antivirus
enable.step3: Confirm the action in the dialog
enable.step4: The agent will start the antivirus service and report the new status
enable.title: Enabling Antivirus

remove.description: To completely remove antivirus software from a host:
remove.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
remove.step2: In the Antivirus card, click Remove Antivirus
remove.step5: The agent will stop services, uninstall packages, and clean up configuration files
remove.title: Removing Antivirus
remove.warning1: Antivirus removal is irreversible from the web interface
remove.warning2: System will be unprotected after removal
remove.warning3: Virus definition databases and logs will be deleted
remove.warning4: Use the "Deploy Antivirus" button to reinstall if needed

linux.chkrootkit: chkrootkit - Tool to check for signs of a rootkit
linux.clamav: ClamAV - Cross-platform antivirus engine for detecting trojans, viruses, malware, and other malicious threats
linux.description: SysManage supports the following open-source antivirus solutions on Linux:
linux.rkhunter: rkhunter - Rootkit Hunter scans for rootkits, backdoors, and local exploits

windows.service: Windows service integration for real-time protection

antivirus.title: Antivirus Management - SysManage Administration

deploy_button_disabled.cause1: No default antivirus package is configured for this OS - configure one in Settings > Antivirus
deploy_button_disabled.cause2: Host is not active or not connected
deploy_button_disabled.cause3: Agent is not running with elevated privileges
deploy_button_disabled.cause4: You don't have the DEPLOY_ANTIVIRUS security role
deploy_button_disabled.cause5: Antivirus is already deployed on this host
deploy_button_disabled.title: Deploy Button is Disabled

deployment_failed.solution1: Check host's internet connectivity - package downloads require internet access
deployment_failed.solution2: Verify package manager is working correctly on the host
deployment_failed.solution3: Check agent logs on the host for detailed error messages
deployment_failed.solution4: Ensure sufficient disk space is available
deployment_failed.solution5: On macOS, verify Homebrew is installed and working

architecture.description: De integratie tussen SysManage en OpenBAO cre√´ert een fort-achtige beveiligingsarchitectuur die uw meest gevoelige gegevens beschermt.
architecture.principle1: Zero Trust: Elke toegangsaanvraag wordt geauthenticeerd en geautoriseerd

architecture.principle3: Minimale Blootstelling: Geheimen worden alleen ontsleuteld wanneer nodig
architecture.principle4: Uitgebreide Auditing: Elke operatie wordt gelogd en traceerbaar
architecture.principle5: Principe van Minste Privilege: Toegang wordt alleen verleend zoals nodig

welcome.description: SysManage is een uitgebreid infrastructuurmonitoring en automatiseringsplatform dat u helpt bij het beheren van hosts, pakketten en systeemgezondheid in uw gehele infrastructuur. Of u nu een paar servers of duizenden hosts beheert, SysManage biedt de tools die u nodig heeft om uw systemen effectief te onderhouden en te monitoren.
